response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (22)", "medium", "Younger offenders typically have a higher risk of recidivism due to less maturity and established routines, though at 22 it is moderately risky."],
    ["Race (Black)", "low", "Race alone is not a direct predictor of criminal behavior, though systemic factors can influence outcomes, it is assigned a low relative risk here."],
    ["Arrest History (6 arrests, no convictions)", "high", "Multiple arrests indicate frequent contact with the criminal justice system, which is a strong risk factor even without convictions."],
    ["Physical Characteristics (6ft 2in, 140 lbs)", "low", "Physical stature is generally not a robust predictor of recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status/Living Situation (Never married, living alone)", "medium", "Living alone and never being married can indicate reduced social support, moderately increasing risk."],
    ["Education (No high school diploma/GED, not in college)", "high", "Lack of educational attainment is strongly associated with recidivism due to reduced opportunities and social capital."],
    ["Employment (No jobs held in the past year)", "high", "Unemployment is a well-established risk factor for recidivism due to economic stress and lack of structure."],
    ["Substance Use (Marijuana and cocaine use, recent use)", "high", "Recent drug use significantly heightens the risk of recidivism, as it can impair judgment and is linked to criminal behavior."],
    ["Mental Well-being (Persistent depressive symptoms)", "high", "Ongoing depressive symptoms are indicative of potential mental health struggles that can interfere with rehabilitation and increase recidivism risk."],
    ["Family Background (Household of size 4 in childhood)", "low", "A typical household size in childhood offers limited insight into recidivism risk, thus considered low risk."],
    ["Religious Belief (Believes that God influences personal destiny)", "low", "Personal religious beliefs generally do not predict recidivism risk and may even provide some protective social support."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Age (22)
medium
Younger offenders typically have a higher risk of recidivism due to less maturity and established routines, though at 22 it is moderately risky.
Race (Black)
low
Race alone is not a direct predictor of criminal behavior, though systemic factors can influence outcomes, it is assigned a low relative risk here.
Arrest History (6 arrests, no convictions)
high
Multiple arrests indicate frequent contact with the criminal justice system, which is a strong risk factor even without convictions.
Physical Characteristics (6ft 2in, 140 lbs)
low
Physical stature is generally not a robust predictor of recidivism risk.
Marital Status/Living Situation (Never married, living alone)
medium
Living alone and never being married can indicate reduced social support, moderately increasing risk.
Education (No high school diploma/GED, not in college)
high
Lack of educational attainment is strongly associated with recidivism due to reduced opportunities and social capital.
Employment (No jobs held in the past year)
high
Unemployment is a well-established risk factor for recidivism due to economic stress and lack of structure.
Substance Use (Marijuana and cocaine use, recent use)
high
Recent drug use significantly heightens the risk of recidivism, as it can impair judgment and is linked to criminal behavior.
Mental Well-being (Persistent depressive symptoms)
high
Ongoing depressive symptoms are indicative of potential mental health struggles that can interfere with rehabilitation and increase recidivism risk.
Family Background (Household of size 4 in childhood)
low
A typical household size in childhood offers limited insight into recidivism risk, thus considered low risk.
Religious Belief (Believes that God influences personal destiny)
low
Personal religious beliefs generally do not predict recidivism risk and may even provide some protective social support.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 6 times but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 2 inches and weighs 140 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and all of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived in a household of size 4. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
